remarks: Lemma for ~ nmoleub2a and similar theorems.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Oct-2015.)
statement:
nmoleub2.n $e |- N = ( S normOp T ) $.
nmoleub2.v $e |- V = ( Base ` S ) $.
nmoleub2.l $e |- L = ( norm ` S ) $.
nmoleub2.m $e |- M = ( norm ` T ) $.
nmoleub2.g $e |- G = ( Scalar ` S ) $.
nmoleub2.w $e |- K = ( Base ` G ) $.
nmoleub2.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. ( NrmMod i^i CMod ) ) $.
nmoleub2.t $e |- ( ph -> T e. ( NrmMod i^i CMod ) ) $.
nmoleub2.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( S LMHom T ) ) $.
nmoleub2.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. RR* ) $.
nmoleub2.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. RR+ ) $.
nmoleub2lem.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ A. x e. V ( ps -> ( ( M ` ( F ` x ) ) / R ) <_ A ) ) -> 0 <_ A ) $.
nmoleub2lem.6 $e |- ( ( ( ( ph /\ A. x e. V ( ps -> ( ( M ` ( F ` x ) ) / R ) <_ A ) ) /\ A e. RR ) /\ ( y e. V /\ y =/= ( 0g ` S ) ) ) -> ( M ` ( F ` y ) ) <_ ( A x. ( L ` y ) ) ) $.
nmoleub2lem.7 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. V ) -> ( ps -> ( L ` x ) <_ R ) ) $.
nmoleub2lem $p |- ( ph -> ( ( N ` F ) <_ A <-> A. x e. V ( ps -> ( ( M ` ( F ` x ) ) / R ) <_ A ) ) ) $.
